description: From Old English āsċamian, āsċeamian, from ā- + sċeamian (“feel shame”), from Proto-Germanic *skamēnan, from *skamō (“shame, humiliation”).

verbs.description: ashame (third-person singular simple present ashames, present participle ashaming, simple past and past participle ashamed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, obsolete) To feel shame; to be ashamed.
(transitive, rare) To make ashamed; to shame.
examples: I am young Woman indifferently well brought up in the Country, and might raiſe my fortune conſiderably had I not got ſuch a Habit of Sweating, which quite aſhames me, when in Company, to ſee my Face of a dewy Sweat, and the generality complain of Cold.
